    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • addConversation

        public static void addConversation(java.lang.String serviceId,
                   java.lang.String contactId,
                   java.lang.String contactChannelValue)
        Registers a new conversation in zingle_android_sdk. If succeed, system begins to receive all messages for ZingleContact with specified ID and it's possible to open UI for this conversation with showConversation().
        Parameters:
        serviceId - ID of service, which participate in conversation
        contactId - ID of contact, which participate in conversation
        contactChannelValue - contact channel value for sending messages to service (see ZingleNewMessage.correspondent.channel.value)

      • addConversation

        public static void addConversation(java.lang.String serviceId,
                   java.lang.String contactId,
                   java.lang.String contactChannelValue,
                   ZingleUIInitAndStart.ConversationAdderBase ca)
        Same as addConversation(String serviceId, String contactId, String contactChannelValue), but allow to customize the process through overloading onPreExecute(), onPostExecute(Boolean aBoolean), onProgressUpdate(String... values). See ConversationAdder and AsyncTask for more information.
        onProgressUpdate(String... values) is triggered 4 times:
      • After registering service: values "1" and service's DisplayName (see ZingleService) or "Failed"
      • After registering contact: values "2" and contact's id (see ZingleContact) of "Failed"
      • After trying to find proper channel type: values "3" and allowed channel typeclass (see ZingleChannelType) or "Failed"
      • After registering conversation participants: values "4" and "UI ready".
Parameters:
serviceId - ID of service, which participate in conversation
contactId - ID of contact, which participate in conversation
contactChannelValue - contact channel value for sending messages to service (see ZingleNewMessage.correspondent.channel.value)
ca - customized implementation of ConversationAdderBase

  • initializeConnection

    public static boolean initializeConnection(java.lang.String apiURL,
                           java.lang.String apiVersion,
                           java.lang.String token,
                           java.lang.String password)
    Initializes basic parameters for connecting to API. Doesn't make any verification (it means true answer doesn't mean that login and password are correct and URL is working).
    Parameters:
    apiURL - URL, that give access to API
    apiVersion - API version string in form v{number}
    token - user name for API
    password - password for API
    Returns:
    true if apiURL meets URL standards, otherwise - false

  • showConversation

    public static void showConversation(Context context,
                    java.lang.String serviceId)
    Starts and shows the UI for required conversation (defined by serviceId)
    Parameters:
    context - current context (in most cases can be get as this if function runs in activity)
    serviceId - the ID of service to show conversation with

  • startMessageReceiver

    public static void startMessageReceiver(Context context)
    Starts message receiving for all registered conversations. Conversations may be added seamlessly before and after triggering this function.
    Parameters:
    context - current application context (can be get in activity by getApplicationContext())
